newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand to help brokerages with margin loan woes.
newsitem.headline: Thailand to help brokerages with margin loan woes.

text.p: The Thai Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) said on Friday it planned measures to help brokerages hit by high levels of outstanding margin loans from clients due to a prolonged stock market slump.
"The margin loan problem has to be resolved as quickly as possible, otherwise it will harm the stability of securities companies," SEC chief Pakorn Malakul Na Ayudhya told reporters.
He said the Securities Finance Corp (SFC) would purchase the margin loans from securities companies on the condition they bought the loans back within five years.
The SFC, which was established last year as a lending centre for Thai securities companies, would raise funds through the issue of bonds, he added.
Total outstanding margin loans of all securities amounted to about 120 billion baht ($4.6 billion) of which 90 billion baht were unresolved, he said.
The margin loans which would be bought by the SFC must be loans granted for the purchase of blue-chip and highly-liquid shares, Pakorn said.
Other details would be disclosed after the finance ministry approved the planned measures.
